intro: Licania dealbata, commonly known as the white-leafed licania, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, white pubescence. It produces showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators. Licania dealbata is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and along riverbanks.
